intro: Platanthera leptocaulon, commonly known as the slender-leaved twayblade, is a member of the Orchidaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, shaded forest environments. The plant has a slender, leafless stem that supports a single, elongated flower spike. Its flowers are usually greenish-yellow with a distinctive lip that is often pale yellow or white. The species is characterized by its reduced leaves and specialized root system adapted for nutrient uptake in poor soils.
